data.title: Thai govt vows stronger fight against corruption
data.description: The government has vowed to be proactive in addressing corruption in a bid to raise the country’s Corruption Perceptions Index (CPI) score from 35 to over 50 out of 100.

data.title: Activist beefs up petition targeting Pheu Thai over handouts
data.description: Activist Sonthiya Sawasdee has provided additional documents to support his  petition  filed with the  Constitutional Court  against the  Pheu Thai  Party for allegedly failing to honour its  election-policy  10,000-baht digital wallet scheme.

data.title: Train services back to normal in southern Thailand Thursday
data.description: All southern trains will resume normal operations on Thursday after fatal flooding in the region damaged the tracks, forcing them to terminate at Hat Yai station.

data.title: Thais, Malaysians caught as Malaysia begins enforcing border laws
data.description: Malaysian police have made their first  arrests  since Malaysia began enforcing bans on its citizens  illegally crossing the border  into  Thailand  from  Kelantan  state.

data.title: Former protest leader sets deadline for govt to scrap MoU with Cambodia
data.description: A group led by former yellow-shirt protest leader  Sondhi Limthongkul  arrived at Government House’s complaint centre in Bangkok on Monday and demanded the government scrap its 2001 memorandum of understanding (MoU) with  Cambodia  or face  demonstrations .

data.title: Young singer died of blood poisoning after massages
data.description: UDON THANI - A  young singer who died  after three sessions at a local  massage  parlour that included  neck twisting  had died from  blood poisoning  and an autopsy is needed to determine the actual facts of her death, the provincial health chief said on Monday.

data.title: 23 Thais still in Syria, people rejoice as Assad flees
data.description: A number of Thai citizens in Syria have decided to stay in that country to evaluate the situation before deciding whether they would return home.

data.title: Foreigners, Thais arrested for making, selling pornography
data.description: Four foreign men and three Thais have been arrested on charges of making sex videos in Thailand that were sold worldwide.

data.title: 'Humans to blame' for devastating floods in Northern Thailand
data.description: Flooding  has devasted many parts of Thailand this year.

data.title: Exhausted Russian found naked in sea off Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA - An exhausted, naked Russian man has been rescued from the sea by a Koh Lan-bound speedboat driver about six kilometres off Pattaya.

data.title: Singaporean dies after massage on Phuket beach
data.description: PHUKET - A Singaporean vacationing in Phuket has died shortly after a lengthy body massage at Patong beach, in Kathu district, police said.

data.title: Thai PM to go live over govt record
data.description: Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra  is due to make a major public address on Thursday in which she will outline her cabinet

data.title: Humans to blame for devastating floods in North: activist
data.description: Flooding  has devasted many parts of Thailand this year.

data.title: Russian man found naked in sea between Pattaya and Koh Lan
data.description: PATTAYA: A naked and exhausted Russian man was rescued by a Koh Lan-bound speedboat driver in the sea about six kilometres off Pattaya.

data.title: Ministry to speed up Pluak Daeng 2 Hospital work
data.description: The Ministry of Public Health has vowed to speed up construction of Pluak Daeng 2 Hospital, which has been delayed for two years, to serve people living in the Eastern Economic Corridor (EEC).

data.title: Suspects held after fatal stabbing
data.description: Four men were arrested on Sunday in connection with the fatal stabbing of a 19-year-old in Bang Kae district on Saturday night, police said.

data.title: Group protests to demand trawler crew's release
data.description: A group of local fishermen are planning to gather at Ranong Provincial Hall today to push for the repatriation of the four Thai fishing crew who are detained in Myanmar following an incident in a disputed maritime area off the coast of Ranong last week.

data.title: Govt hails FTA talks with Britain
data.description: Thailand and the United Kingdom are in talks to expand trade and investment between the two countries under a free trade agreement (FTA).

data.title: Ex-BJT lawmakers freed on parole
data.description: Three former Bhumjaithai Party MPs who were sentenced to nine months in prison in June this year for ethical violations were released on parole on Sunday.

data.title: Malaysia eyes legal reforms
data.description: As the 2025 chair of Asean, Malaysia aims to focus on business law reforms to ensure legal protections for businesses across Asean member countries, said Azalina Othman Said, Minister in the Prime Minister

data.description: There was a young man, the son of a police officer who died on duty during the southern insurgency. He decided to follow in his Dad
